content: <@412614104222531604> I lied! Pectra is master but PeerDAS is on https://github.com/Nashatyrev/teku/tree/das

author: barnabasbusa
content:
```yaml
participants:
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerDAS

  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_extra_params: [
        --subscribe-all-data-column-subnets,
    ]
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das

  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das

  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das

  - cl_type: nimbus
    cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:kzgpeerdas

  - cl_type: grandine
    cl_image: ethpandaops/grandine:das

  # - cl_type: lodestar
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/lodestar:peerDAS
network_params:
  eip7594_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7594_fork_version: "0x50000038"
snooper_enabled: true
global_log_level: debug
additional_services:
  - dora
  - goomy_blob
```

author: barnabasbusa
content: This kurtosis config should in theory work

author: barnabasbusa
content: Lodestar image is currently unavailable.

author: barnabasbusa
content: After two epochs, with blob spamming only missed slots are from nimbus. (first lh can be ignored)

author: manunlp
content:
FI on Prysm we have a hidden option: 
`--data-columns-withhold-count=<n>`, where `<n>` is the number of columns a block proposer will withhold.
```
["2024-06-18 09:50:58"]  WARNING "rpc/validator": "Withholding data column" dataColumnIndex=0 ...
```
This option can be used to check the effectiveness of matrix reconstruction on node able to reconstruct.

content: <@476250636548308992> is prysm peerdas branch alpha 3 compliant (enr struc)?

content: I think we changed it afaik

author: barnabasbusa
content: Then I guess we should aim to use alpha 3 spec for all clients

content: otherwise we won't be able to peer nicely

author: barnabasbusa
content: I thought the idea was to try to lag behind one release

author: manunlp
content:
We are compliant with the change introduced here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3772.

> I thought the idea was to try to lag behind one release
I did not know that. If needed, I can revert this change.

author: barnabasbusa
content: I'm happy to keep things moving forward, as long as all other client teams are on the same page

author: agnxsh
content: i think we can start the devnet by atleast next week, Nimbus is in-between some rework with the new changes in the C-api, plus our enr hasn't been reworked yet

author: manunlp
content:
Well, honestly it is up to you. I would prefer to keep this new ENR struct, as it is a very easy change to implement and as it will be the one used in production.
But I won't oppose any resistance if the consensus asks me to revert ðŸ™‚

author: barnabasbusa
content: seems like the enr changes are backwards compatible? Or teku/lh also implemented the new enr style?

author: barnabasbusa
content: prysm/lh/teku pairs seems to produce 100% performance. Nimbus/grandine can't seem to stay sync. Nimbus with older branch breaks prysm, where prysm will unpeer from all of its peers. (super strange).

author: jimmygchen
content: no we haven't implemented it

author: barnabasbusa
content: would you be compatible with the new enr style?

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
We don't use it actually
But will make update, so other clients could use our ENR with updated structure

author: barnabasbusa
content: yes please. Please make sure `nashatyrev/das` branch is alpha 3 spec compliant

author: jimmygchen
content: Yeah sort of compatible for regular full nodes - if we don't see the key, we assume the node custodies the default number of subnets

author: jimmygchen
content: but nodes won't detect supernode peers, so we should implement it for devnet-1. Also applies the other way around (supernodes won't be detected by peers).
